root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: State Pension Age (Compensation): Ten Minute Rule Motion

MotionText.from_cdata: That leave be given to bring in a Bill to require the Secretary of State to publish proposals for a compensation scheme for women born between 6 April 1950 and 5 April 1960 inclusive who have been affected by increases in the state pension age; and for connected purposes.

from_cdata.p: The Member moving and a Member opposing this Motion may each speak for up to 10 minutes.

root.DebateTimingRubric: Up to three hours (Order of 5 February)

MotionText.from_cdata: That the Police Grant Report (England and Wales) 2024–25 (HC 482), which was laid before this House on 31 January, be approved.

span.style: font-size: 14.0pt; font-family: 'Calibri',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-font-kerning: 0pt; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;

p.span: The Instrument has not yet been considered by the Select Committee on Statutory Instruments.

root.DebateTimingRubric: Up to three hours (or six hours after commencement of proceedings on the motion on the Police Grant Report, whichever is the later) (Order of 5 February)

MotionTextIndented.from_cdata: That the Local Government Finance Report (England) 2024–25 (HC 318), which was laid before this House on 5 February, be approved.

from_cdata.p: The Instrument has not yet been considered by the Select Committee on Statutory Instruments.
Third Report of the Levelling Up, Housing and Communities Committee, Financial distress in local authorities, HC 56

MotionTextIndented.from_cdata: That the Referendums Relating to Council Tax Increases (Principles) (England) Report 2024–25 (HC 319), which was laid before this House on 5 February, be approved.

from_cdata.p: The Instrument has not yet been considered by the Select Committee on Statutory Instruments.

MotionTextIndented.from_cdata: That the Referendums Relating to Council Tax Increases (Alternative Notional Amounts) (England) Report 2024–25 (HC 320), which was laid before this House on 5 February, be approved.

from_cdata.p: The Instrument has not yet been considered by the Select Committee on Statutory Instruments.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Lora, serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;

from_cdata.span: That, at this day’s sitting, the Motion in the name of Penny Mordaunt relating to Business of the House (Today) may be proceeded with, though opposed, until any hour, and Standing Order No. 41A (Deferred divisions) shall not apply.

root.DebateTimingRubric: Until any hour (if the 7.00pm Business of the House motion is agreed to)

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Lora,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: That, notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph (14) of Standing Order No. 80A (Carry-over of bills), the Speaker shall put the Questions necessary to dispose of proceedings on the Motions in the names of:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Lora,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: (1) Secretary Michelle Donelan relating to the Data Protection and Digital Information Bill: Carry-over extension; and

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Lora,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: (2) Secretary Alex Chalk relating to the Victims and Prisoners Bill: Carry-over extension

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Lora,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: not later than one and a half hours after the commencement of proceedings on the Motion for this Order; such Questions shall include the Questions on any Amendments selected by the Speaker which may then be moved; proceedings may continue, though opposed, after the moment of interruption; and Standing Order No. 41A (Deferred divisions) shall not apply.

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: DATA PROTECTION AND DIGITAL INFORMATION BILL: CARRY-OVER EXTENSION
root.DebateTimingRubric: Up to 90 minutes after the commencement of proceedings on the Business of the House (Today) motion (if that motion is agreed to)

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-right: 0cm; margin-left: 0cm; margin-bottom: 13.5pt; box-sizing: border-box;

from_cdata.p: That the period on the expiry of which proceedings on the Data Protection and Digital Information Bill shall lapse in pursuance of paragraph (13) of Standing Order No. 80A shall be extended by 280 days until 12 December 2024.

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: VICTIMS AND PRISONERS BILL: CARRY-OVER EXTENSION
root.DebateTimingRubric: Up to 90 minutes after the commencement of proceedings on the Business of the House (Today) motion (if that motion is agreed to)

span.style: color: #666666; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: small;

from_cdata.span: That the period on the expiry of which proceedings on the Victims and Prisoners Bill shall lapse in pursuance of paragraph (13) of Standing Order No. 80A shall be extended by 259 days until 12 December 2024.

MotionText.from_cdata: That the draft Gender Recognition (Approved Countries and Territories and Saving Provision) Order 2023, which was laid before this House on 6 December 2023, be approved.

root.DebateTimingRubric: Until 7.30pm or for half an hour (whichever is later) (Standing Order No. 9(7))
The first part of the sitting will last for two hours. The second part of the sitting will last for three hours (Standing Order No. 10(1)).

from_cdata.p: The sitting will be suspended from 11.30am to 2.30pm.
